title: Environmentally persistent free radicals readily form on TiO2 but not on ZnO nanoparticles
content:
Environ. Sci.: Nano, 2024, Accepted Manuscript

Eric Vejerano, Jeonghyeon Ahn
Environmentally persistent free radicals (EPFRs) are stable organic radicals and pollutants in atmospheric and soil particles. Knowledge of EPFR formation on pristine, unsupported engineered nanoparticles is limited. This study investigates...
